prior_works.title: Fast Computation of Wasserstein Barycenters
prior_works.role: Introduced entropic-regularized OT barycenters and practical algorithms
prior_works.relationship_sentence: The paper’s target—continuous entropic OT barycenter estimation—directly builds on the Sinkhorn-based entropic barycenter framework initiated here, extending it beyond standard discrete settings and toward general costs.

prior_works.title: Iterative Bregman Projections for Regularized Transportation Problems
prior_works.authors: Jean-David Benamou, Guillaume Carlier, Marco Cuturi, Luca Nenna, Gabriel Peyré
prior_works.role: Provided the algorithmic backbone (IBP) for entropic OT and barycenters
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Their projection-based scheme underpins much of the algorithmic understanding of entropic OT/barycenters that the new method departs from, replacing matrix-based IBP with a continuous, dual, energy-guided optimization.

prior_works.title: Kantorovich Duality for the Weak Transport Costs
prior_works.authors: Nathael Gozlan, Cyril Roberto, Paul-Marie Samson, Prasad Tetali
prior_works.role: Established the dual formulation of weak optimal transport
prior_works.relationship_sentence: The core of the new method is a dual reformulation of entropic OT via weak OT; this work provides the foundational duality that enables handling arbitrary OT cost functions through weak-OT structure.

prior_works.title: Stochastic Optimization for Large-Scale Optimal Transport
prior_works.authors: Antoine Genevay, Gabriel Peyré, Marco Cuturi, Francis R. Bach
prior_works.role: Pioneered stochastic/dual optimization of (entropic) OT with continuous measures
prior_works.relationship_sentence: The proposed continuous barycenter estimator inherits the idea of optimizing dual potentials with stochastic sampling, extending it to the weak-OT-based dual of entropic OT and to the multi-measure barycenter setting.

prior_works.title: Interpolating between Optimal Transport and MMD using Sinkhorn Divergences
prior_works.authors: Jean Feydy, Thibault Séjourné, François-Xavier Vialard, Alain Trouvé, Gabriel Peyré
prior_works.role: Stabilized entropic OT via bias-corrected divergences and broadened cost flexibility
prior_works.relationship_sentence: By promoting differentiable, stable objectives for entropic OT across diverse costs, this work informs the new paper’s emphasis on general-cost practicality and gradient-based training for continuous barycenters.

prior_works.title: Bayesian Learning via Stochastic Gradient Langevin Dynamics
prior_works.role: Provided scalable MCMC (SGLD) widely used to train energy-based models
prior_works.relationship_sentence: The new method leverages EBM training toolkits; SGLD supplies the sampling/gradient-estimation machinery to optimize energy-like dual objectives without resorting to min–max or REINFORCE tricks.

prior_works.title: Your Classifier is Secretly an Energy Based Model
prior_works.authors: Will Grathwohl, Kuan-Chieh Wang, Jörn-Henrik Jacobsen, David Duvenaud, Mohammad Norouzi, Kevin Swersky
prior_works.role: Popularized practical EBM training with Langevin dynamics and replay buffers
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Their robust EBM training recipes directly motivate the paper’s claim that EBM procedures can be plugged into the weak-OT dual to yield a practical, stable optimization scheme for continuous entropic barycenters.

synthesis_narrative: The paper’s key contribution—an energy-guided algorithm for continuous entropic OT barycenters under general cost functions—rests on three pillars developed in prior work. First, the entropic barycenter paradigm and its algorithmic realizations were established by Cuturi and Doucet and then generalized via Iterative Bregman Projections, providing the practical baseline for computing Sinkhorn-regularized barycenters. Second, the mathematical bridge enabling general costs is weak optimal transport. Gozlan et al. supplied the crucial duality for weak transport costs; combined with entropic regularization, this permits a dual reformulation of EOT that the new method exploits to sidestep discrete couplings and handle continuous measures and arbitrary costs. Genevay et al. demonstrated that stochastic optimization of dual potentials is viable at scale for continuous OT, foreshadowing the paper’s continuous, sample-based optimization of barycentric duals. Third, the algorithmic engine derives from energy-based modeling: SGLD and modern EBM training practice (e.g., JEM) offer well-tuned, MCMC-based gradient estimators for energy functions, enabling the proposed energy-guided optimization to avoid adversarial min–max or REINFORCE-style estimators. Sinkhorn divergences further motivate stable, differentiable entropic objectives across diverse costs. Together, these works supply the dual-analytic framework (weak OT), the entropic barycenter objective, and the EBM-driven optimization toolkit that directly shape the paper’s general-cost, continuous barycenter estimator and its quality guarantees.
